word:
My dear daughter May Lacey White, and (Grandchildren) Henry, Herbert, and Gracie: We are pleasantly situated here, but I am longing for home. I do so much want to see you all. Your father has worked very hard, and he 


                                   -47- 

wants to go home as much as you want him to come. But the future of the work here demanded our staying for a while. We could not have gone home earlier. . . .
